description:
Job Summary:

 

We seek an energetic, highly analytical, and detail-oriented Purchasing/Logistics Specialist to join our International Purchasing team. The Purchasing/ Logistics Specialist will be responsible for managing the procurement process, negotiating with suppliers, and handling logistics ensuring the timely delivery of goods and services. The ideal candidate will have experience in sourcing, category management, and supply chain management including logistics. Import/Export or freight forwarding experience is preferred, but not required. Proficient in MS Office. Fluent in English, bilingual in Mandarin/ Chinese a plus (not required). BS degree in Business or related areas is a plus Salary is based on experience, education, and qualifications in this area (negotiable).


Responsibilities:


- Analyze procurement data to identify cost-saving opportunities

- Develop and implement procurement strategies to optimize supplier performance

- Source and procure goods and services at the best possible price

- Negotiate contracts and agreements with suppliers

- Monitor supplier performance and address any issues or concerns

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment on procurement goals

- Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in procurement


Experience:


- Bachelor’s degree in business administration (a plus), Supply Chain Management, or a related field

- Proven experience in procurement or supply chain management including logistics

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data

- Knowledge of federal acquisition regulations (FAR) is preferred

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis tools

- Excellent communication and negotiation skills

- Attention to detail and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

 

Join us and become an integral part of our team dedicated to excellence in procurement and logistics management.

 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

 

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental Insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8-hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Associate (Required)

Experience:

  • Logistics: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Purchasing: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

  • Pico Rivera, CA 90660 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Pico Rivera, CA 90660: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
